Articles.Content:
Awesome! I'm glad you guys made the explosion shockwave look very cartoony (I'm on the non-realism side).

I'm more in the realism camp for gameplay but I like the cartoonish aspect of failures in KSP. Almost everybody fails a lot at first, the comical explosions and bobble head appearance of the kerbals changes failing from being a negative experience into a funny one. It's more like seeing Wile E. Coyote fall off a cliff than seeing a photorealistic mountain climber fall into a crevasse. An important part of the kerbal experience is laughing at disastrous failure.

OH! The secret feature is shockwaves on explosions! Wait... no, I forgot it's a feature that's related to that huge art project that is using around 60 assets. Maybe Maxmaps hinted the secret feature was in the explosion to mislead us...
also of note, there appears to be a smaller explosion cloud from the tail parts. so explosions are somewhat size dependent confirmed.

Maybe we're going at this wrong. It's something that you see if you're a bad player and very rarely a good player. That doesn't mean it HAS to be crash-related. Maybe it's something else.

It might even be something that makes good players bad at the game until they learn to fix it. For instance if aerodynamic disassembly was added, players that are good won't care about super-high gees in atmosphere yet until Aerodisassembly is added.

I made a webm for you guys. Mind you it being silent it is kinda terrible at conveying the new sound effects, but it sounds great.

Edit: No features were toggled on or off for this, but I'm gonna shut up because reading those last couple pages has made nervous about your closeness to figuring it all out

So, crew training, crazy cloning, or space tourists it is, then!

Or Kerbal Customization! It's a legitimate possibility!

Edited September 20, 2014 by CptRichardson

Then this game is not for you. If they took away the realism then this game would be nothing like it was today. This game already has a balance where it has the best of both worlds, changing it to completely arcade or vice versa would completey change what this game is. One of the good things about this game is that you actually can learn a great deal from it while at the same time it has fun stuff like the wacky green kerbals.

I should've said "I'm not on the total realism side" then.
Maybe the secret feature is actually a new part?

Maybe the secret feature is actually a new part?

But it has to be something experienced players won't see often unless they seek it out.

I made a webm for you guys. Mind you it being silent it is kinda terrible at conveying the new sound effects, but it sounds great.

Edit: No features were toggled on or off for this, but I'm gonna shut up because reading those last couple pages has made nervous about your closeness to figuring it all out

This looks less dramatic and impressive than the stills that were posted in the blog. Is this of a previous version of the new explosions or the exact same taken from a different angle?

Also have you guys considered making it so not every part is packed with C4 and vaporizes on contact? We all love big explosions but objects that aren't fuel tanks and engines disappearing on contact feels kinda cheap.

Maybe the secret feature is actually a new part?
But it has to be something experienced players won't see often unless they seek it out.

So a really crappy part then, that looks really cool?

So a really crappy part then, that looks really cool?

Like the nosecones.

Like the nosecones.

Ah yes, I remember when I used to slap nosecones on everything, lol

I just found something out. Remember this pic from the devnotes a while ago?:

Maybe...just maybe this is hinting at destructible space center buildings. If so, I'm pushing the regulator to max hype.

So a really crappy part then, that looks really cool?

Another shielded docking port?! Oh come on!

Ah yes, I remember when I used to slap nosecones on everything, lol

I still slap nosecones on everything, for the same reason I make my planes look aerodynamic (i.e. pointy): they look a lot cooler.

I still slap nosecones on everything, for the same reason I make my planes look aerodynamic (i.e. pointy): they look a lot cooler.

Exactly... thats why i am using fairings without having an aerodynamic mod installed... it just looks more rocket (and a lot cooler).

no features were toggled on or off for this, but i'm gonna shut up because reading those last couple pages has made nervous about your closeness to figuring it all out

kerbal hospitals

I think you got confused. Porkjet said he wants to make his own landing gear mod that will compliment the new Mk. II parts. He doesn't work for squad, I don't think he is going to be altering their parts.
Let's say, what if someone was going to not only make smaller and bigger landing gear versions, but also planned to make a new model for the current landing gear, what changes would you like to see about it?

From his SP+ thread. I think he meant the stock landing gear, because there's no current landing gear in the mod itself. But I might be wrong of course.

Edited September 21, 2014 by Veeltch

I just found something out. Remember this pic from the devnotes a while ago?:

http://i.imgur.com/xQQVl7s.png

Maybe...just maybe this is hinting at destructible space center buildings. If so, I'm pushing the regulator to max hype.

Dude, you're NOT the HypeTrain driver! If you were you'd know that the HypeTrain has no regulator, and that the driver(that's me)'s own Hype levels regulates the steam!

Maybe...just maybe this is hinting at destructible space center buildings. If so, I'm pushing the regulator to max hype.

It just might be. It's the best guess I've heared. How many funds will it cost to rebuild it? Mortimer won't be happy about that, I say.

I'm guessing right now the secret feature has something to do with debris on the KSP scene (the main menu scene). I think they're adding "life" to that scene: maybe we'll see kerbals and trucks running around, akin to what we have inside the VAB and the SPH - but something procedural, related to debris left on the area. Like disaster crews managing accident locations (maybe even fire trucks and guys in hazmat suits). Something that would be fun to watch, and would make you want to fill your courtyard with wreckage.
I only hope that if the emergency clean up team theory is true, that the guys on the ground can be hit by rockets. *Evil grin*

The ground crew that cleans up the vicinity of KSC would be very useful. I could finally have the debris option turned back on without running the risk of low fps every rocket launch, and could watch my Kessler ring grow around the planet.

I only hope that if the emergency clean up team theory is true, that the guys on the ground can be hit by rockets. *Evil grin*

Well, that would be cruel, but would make the KSP YouTube videos even more popular.

Choo-Choo!

Hope experimentals are going well.

Edited September 21, 2014 by Holyvision
